pr_title: docs - add deprecation notice to THREAD-SAFE custom option

timeline.message: docs - add deprecation notice to THREAD-SAFE custom option
edits due to THREAD-SAFE can be specified on read or write

timeline.bodyText: should we remove this altogether from this table as it serves no value going forward ? Deprecated means still working slated for removal in the future, it is no longer working here ? If we want to mention it, maybe have a special notice section ?
timeline.author: denalex
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -72,7 +72,7 @@ The `hdfs:SequenceFile` profile supports the following custom options: | COMPRESSION_CODEC | The compression codec Java class name. If this option is not provided, Greenplum Database performs no data compression. Supported compression codecs include:
`org.apache.hadoop.io.compress.DefaultCodec`
`org.apache.hadoop.io.compress.BZip2Codec`
`org.apache.hadoop.io.compress.GzipCodec` | | COMPRESSION_TYPE | The compression type to employ; supported values are `RECORD` (the default) or `BLOCK`. | | DATA-SCHEMA | The name of the writer serialization/deserialization class. The jar file in which this class resides must be in the PXF classpath. This option is required for the `hdfs:SequenceFile` profile and has no default value. | -| THREAD-SAFE | Boolean value determining if a table query can run in multi-threaded mode. The default value is `TRUE`.
